title: Is the Tibetan Book of the Dead a literal translation? What happens after death? - Quora

response.answer_text: Like many interpretations regarding life and death written to provide guided insight for the living we should always remember to avoid presuming in absolutes, the one error all philosophical religions seem have in common.To begin with view life and death as an extension of existence rather than a beginning and ending, in so doing you will allow the multi-dimensional reality of you existence to reveal itself as the pedals of a rose slowly unveils its brilliance over your lifetime. Always remember that life and death are just the physical manifestations of our energy in transformation, for we are the energy of existence and we do traverse dimensional boundaries. "There are more things under heaven and earth than man can conceive", wherein absolutes cannot exist! As to what happens after death, take a journey into a past life regression experience and find your own answers for everyone the journey is different and subject to your own interpretation.

“Life after death. Buddhists believe in a cycle of death and rebirth called samsara. Through karma and eventual enlightenment, they hope to escape samsara and achieve nirvana, an end to suffering.” Deserving Christians are told that they’ll go to a heavenly paradise immediately upon dying. Tibetans are told that they’ll keep coming back in another form, until they get it all figured out and are deserving. Then heaven awaits them.
